translated: As much as there is the designation, to that extent there is the infusion of the mind with the designation, because of the connection of the designation with the mind, and because of the latent impressions of the designation. original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te tha snyad kyi dbang gis rgyu rnam pa gsum mngon par 'grub par bstan pa dang / rgyu rnam pa gsum gyi dbang gis mngon par zhen pa skye bar bstan pa ste /

analyzed: bshad par bya ba'i chos kyang gcig kho na ma yin pa'i phyir ji lta ji ltar zhes bya ba gsungs so //

analyzed: ji lta ji ltar gyur ba de dag gi rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pas na /

original: de'i phyir tshig zlos bur de lta de ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig zlos bur de lta de ltar zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: tha snyad rnams kyi dbang gis rgyu rnam pa gsum mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /

analyzed: gnyis pa tha snyad du blo dang 'brel ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni ming dang tha snyad shes pa blo'i rjes su rnam par rtog par gyur pa ste /

analyzed: lha dang mi la sogs pa tha snyad shes pa gang yin pa rnams so //
translated: It is the knowledge of conventional expressions of gods, humans, and so on.

original: gsum pa tha snyad bag la nyal @289b gyi phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni ming dang tha snyad mi shes pa bag la nyal gyi rjes su rnam par rtog par gyur pa ste /

original: ba lang dang lug la sogs pa tha snyad mi shes kyang bag la nyal gyi dbang gis rnam par rtog par gyur ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: ba lang dang lug la sogs pa tha snyad mi shes kyang bag la nyal gyi dbang gis rnam par rtog par gyur ba lta bu ste /
translated: For example, even though one does not know the conventions of ‚Äúcow‚Äù and ‚Äúsheep,‚Äù due to latent impressions, conceptual thoughts arise.

analyzed: des na tha snyad kyi dbang gis rgyu rnam pa gsum mngon par grub par bstan to //

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du mngon par zhen te zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rgyu rnam pa gsum gyi dbang gis mngon par zhen pa skye bar bstan pa ste /

analyzed: rgyu rnam pa gsum las dang po'i rgyu gcig gis ni mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu'i rkyen rab tu bstan to //

analyzed: rgyu phyi ma gnyis kyis ni bdag po'i rkyen rab tu bstan te /
translated: The last two causes indicate the dominant condition.üîΩBy the power of these three causes, one becomes attached to the imagined nature in the two natures.

original: rgyu rnam pa 'di gsum gyi dbang gis ngo bo nyid gnyis po dag la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen par gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa 'di gsum gyi dbang gis ngo bo nyid gnyis po dag la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen par gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the above passage.

original: ji lta ji ltar mngon par zhen pa de lta de ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa mngon par zhenüîΩpa'i dbang gis 'khor ba'i chos can du gyur bar bstan to //

translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúAs one becomes more and more attached‚Äù explains the second, the fact that one becomes a subject of cyclic life by the power of attachment.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te snga ma'i mngon par zhen pa bzlog nas 'khor ba'i rgyu rab tu bstan pa dang / mngon par zhen pas 'khor ba'i 'bras bu bskyed pa rab tu bstan pa ste 'di ni dang po'o //

translated: This also has two parts: explaining the cause of cyclic life by reversing the former attachment and explaining the production of the effect of cyclic life by attachment. This is the first.

original: ji lta ji ltar zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa'i yul bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa'i yul bstan pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn whatever way‚Äù indicates the object of adherence.

original: mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba yang gcig kho na ma yin pa'i phyir ji lta ji ltar zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba yang gcig kho na ma yin pa'i phyir ji lta ji ltar zhes bya ba gsungs so //

original: ji lta ji ltar gyur ba de dag gi rjes su mngon par zhen pa rnams skye bas de'i phyir tshig zlos bur de lta de ltar zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar gyur ba de dag gi rjes su mngon par zhen pa rnams skye bas de'i phyir tshig zlos bur de lta de ltar zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Since the various kinds of adherence arise in accordance with the various kinds of adherence, therefore the repetition of the word ‚Äúthus‚Äù is stated.

original: mngon par zhan pa des na ngo bo nyid rnam pa gnyis la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen par gyur la /
analyzed: mngon par zhan pa des na ngo bo nyid rnam pa gnyis la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen par gyur la /
translated: By that adherence, one becomes attached to the imagined reality in the two kinds of reality.

original: mngon par zhen pa des ni 'khor bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa des ni 'khor bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By that adherence, one transmigrates in cyclic existence.

original: rgyu dang rkyen des na phyi ma la gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid du kun du bskyed de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa 'khor ba'i 'bras bu bskyed pa rab tu ston to //

translated: By that cause and condition, one generates the other-dependent reality in the future, and so on. This shows the second, the generation of the effect of transmigration.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te gzhan @290a * //
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te gzhan @290a * //
translated: This also has two types:üîΩ

analyzed: gyi dbang bskyed pa bstan pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum bskyed pa yongs su bstan pa ste 'di ni dang po'o //

analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa la bye brag ci yod ce na /

analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum po dag tu ni dbang po lnga la sogs pa yongs su gso ba ma bsdus pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gzhi des na nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kyang nyon mongs par 'gyur /

analyzed: yun ring por 'khor ba la rgyun chad pa med ces bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum bskyed pa yongs su ston to //
